intro: Epilobium ramosissimum, commonly known as the silverleaf willow or evergreen willow, is a flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its slender, often silver-hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely. The plant produces small, pink to white flowers clustered in terminal racemes, which bloom in the spring. It is native to regions of Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Epilobium ramosissimum is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other damp habitats.
